timeline.author: cangencer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -178,6 +178,13 @@ Additionally, if the vertex sourcing them is a data source or data sink, then th
 |===
 |Names|Extra tags
 
+|**executionStartTime**: Start time of the current execution of a job. +
+**executionCompletionTime**: Start time of the current execution of a job. +
+
+Both contain epoch time in milliseconds.
+|** * only ones without `vertex` tag** +

replies.bodyText: See the first paragraph of the "Jet Job metrics" section, stating that almost all job metrics have the 'vertex' tag set (ie. are per vertex). So I wanted to point out that these two metrics are the exceptions.
replies.author: jbartok

timeline.author: viliam-durina
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,16 @@ Additionally, if the vertex sourcing them is a data source or data sink, then th
 |===
 |Names|Extra tags
 
+|**executionStartTime**: Start time of the current execution of the job. +
+**executionCompletionTime**: Start time of the current execution of the job. +

timeline.bodyText: they are even missing 'vertex' - no surprise here. I personally would just skip this part, the next sentence is enough,
timeline.author: viliam-durina
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -178,9 +178,16 @@ Additionally, if the vertex sourcing them is a data source or data sink, then th
 |===
 |Names|Extra tags
 
+|**executionStartTime**: Start time of the current execution of the job. +
+**executionCompletionTime**: Start time of the current execution of the job. +
+
+Both contain epoch time in milliseconds.
+|** no extra tags, they are even missing `vertex`** +

timeline.message: Always publish execution start/end time metrics
